courseTitle: Full Stack Web Development: From Zero to Deployment

modules.description: Master the building blocks of interactive web pages.

lessons.content: Learn HTML tags, semantic elements, and best practices for creating well-structured web pages.
Explore CSS selectors, properties, and techniques for styling layouts, typography, and responsiveness.
Learn JavaScript fundamentals, DOM manipulation, event handling, and basic animations.

modules.moduleTitle: Frontend Fundamentals: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

quizzes.explanation:
The

tag is specifically designed for creating paragraphs of text.
quizzes.question: Which HTML tag is used to define a paragraph?

modules.description: Build robust and scalable APIs using Node.js and Express.js.

lessons.content: Learn about Node.js, its event loop, and its role in server-side JavaScript development.
Learn to create RESTful APIs using Express.js, handling requests, responses, and routing.
Integrate a MongoDB database with your Express.js API for data persistence.

modules.moduleTitle: Backend Development with Node.js and Express.js

quizzes.explanation: Express.js is a Node.js web application framework for building APIs and web applications.
quizzes.question: What is the primary function of Express.js?

quizzes.explanation: A RESTful API follows architectural constraints to create predictable and scalable web services.
options: A standardized way of building web services
quizzes.question: What is a RESTful API?

modules.description: Learn how to connect your frontend and backend applications.

lessons.content: Learn how to use the Fetch API to make HTTP requests to your backend API.
Learn how to handle successful and unsuccessful API responses and display data on your frontend.

quizzes.explanation: POST is used to send data to the server to create or update resources.
quizzes.question: What HTTP method is typically used to send data to a server?

modules.description: Learn to deploy your application and manage your code using Git.

lessons.content: Learn the basics of Git, including cloning, committing, and pushing changes.
Learn how to deploy your application to a cloud hosting platform like Netlify or Vercel.
